article_title: Burger King Profit Rises on Lower Costs
article_text:
An emphasis on fewer menu items and fewer company-owned restaurants helped push Burger King Worldwide Inc.'s fourth-quarter earnings up 37%.

The fast-food chain lowered costs in 2013 by selling 360 of its restaurants to franchisees. Burger King also slowed the introduction of new menu items. In the past it rolled out numerous new products each quarter, but executives decided recently to focus on fewer products that it thinks will have...
